title: Nigerian joblessness at all-time high? Checking a politician’s claims
subtitle: As Nigeria’s presidential race heats up, a candidate claims joblessness is at a historic high and more than 10 million young people are unemployed. Do labour force stats agree?
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
• None Presidential candidate Atiku Abubakar claimed Nigeria’s jobless rate was the highest yet, and more than 10 million youth were unemployed.
• None The way unemployment is calculated has changed, so it’s not possible to prove it’s at its highest rate in Nigeria’s history.
• None Labour force data confirms that more than 10 million people defined as “youth” are unemployed.

“It is undesirable for a presidential hopeful to make such a claim because the methodologies have changed,” said Sarah Anyanwu, a professor of development economics at the

She added that the claim would only be true if the comparison were for a period after the methods changed.

Still, if the old method were used to calculate the current rate, unemployment may well be higher than the 23.9% seen in 2011, a director at the statistics bureau, Isiaka Olarewaju, told Africa Check.
